snippet: Police Commissioner William J. Bratton met with the Rev. Al Sharpton to talk about profiling by police in retail stores, which has resulted in several lawsuits by black shoppers.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton and Rev Al Sharpton meet to discuss allegations of profiling by police in some city retail stores; central question has been who has been flagging certain shoppers as suspicious: police or store personnel; in allegations of profiling at Barneys New York and at Macy's, stores say police acted on their own, but Police Dept says stores directed them to stop specific individuals.
lead_paragraph: Police Commissioner William J. Bratton met with the Rev. Al Sharpton to talk about profiling by police in retail stores, which has resulted in several lawsuits by black shoppers.

headline.main: Bratton and Sharpton Discuss Profiling Issue
headline.print_headline: Bratton and Sharpton Discuss Profiling Issue
